page.title: 02Agriculture on Papa Stour.
page.content: Agriculture is the main industry on the island,almost every one's involved.Most people farm sheep,but some cows are kept.The lambs are sold in autumn and shipped to the mainland. Sheep are also kept for their wool and they are sheared in early July.(shetland wool is very warm and light in weight).The {Shetland {sheep}are small but are often crossed with larger breeds to produce bigger carcasses. These large sheep eat more and some supplementary foods are needed in{Winter}e.g sheep nuts, treacle,hay and silage. There are few cows here, and their main product is beef calves to sell. Potatoes and other root crops are produced for home consumption as are pork and poultry.
